title: Lets Talk: Ahri
body:
Look, we get it: Ahri is a problem. Not a huge problem, but a problem nonetheless. Though she is a problem, I think it's important that we talk about some serious misunderstandings here rather than a clear cut circle jerk. "Wahhh, Ahri main crying so that his champ doesn't get nerfed" is probably what most people are going to assume coming in. While she is one of my mains, I'm just here to dispel some... misguided thoughts, if you will.

So, to keep this short and sweet, lets jump right into it. First things first, lets get rid of some incorrect line of thinking:

*  Ahri's numbers are in no way high enough to warrant any nerfs to numbers

*  Ahri is a purely skill shot reliant champ, but that does NOT mean she has a HIGH skill cap. in fact, she has a very moderate skill cap

*  Ahri's core problem is the movement speed on her Q and that is one of 2 things that should be addressed

*  Ahri's ulti CD might be a little TOO low (40s lvl 16 40% cdr)

Suggestions:

*  Tie her movement speed to her ultimate. It can be an ultimate passive where she gets a movement speed boost for hitting a champ. There could also be      an internal CD tied to the passive where it only procs on the same champ every 5/4/3 seconds based on ultimate rank. However, she cannot use this passive if she's already used her ultimate. Or, this passive can be completely removed. I'm indifferent to it on Ahri, either way.

* Her mid and late game ultimate timers can be increased slightly capping at around 50 seconds cd. Any higher could still be detrimental to her as most ultimates in this game cap at 60 cd come late game anyways

Now that all of that is out of the way, lets clear up some other misunderstandings. The above suggestions is the ONLY thing that has to be looked at for Ahri. Ahri has one of the lowest burst and number scalings on most of her abilities out of all mages. I won't go too far into detail explaining anything, because anything I have to say as to why her numbers shouldn't be touched has already been said.

On that note, the reason why a champion like Ahri can have such a high winrate is because of her kit. Ahri doesn't have the most mechanically intensive kit, nor is her kit confusing to use. As a matter of fact, Ahri has one of the most linear, easy to use and easy to understand kit in the game. You don't have to be a master at Ahri to be good at her -- all you have to do is be good at hitting skill shots. That is the ONLY requirement needed to be good at Ahri. 

Due to how fluid her kit is, it gives players an easy time playing on Ahri. Also, unlike binary kits like Garen, she has so much flexibility in her kit that she can adapt playstyles fitting to any game. Most, if not all, matchups against Ahri is skill matchups; albeit those she hard counters. And lets face it, your statistics is taken from Plat+ games... think about how EASY it is for a Plat player to pick up Ahri. If they made it to plat, picking up Ahri and doing well with her is a task that is in no way difficult -- at all. It takes around 15 games playing Ahri to become more than efficient at her. I literally can't think of any champion that's so well rounded, easy to use and safe all at the same time that comes even close to Ahri.

So before you go throwing play rate and winrate around, just remember that she isn't the ONLY champion to boast good winrate numbers from the time she was made. Those numbers don't paint the whole picture.

Until Riot figures out what to do with her Q passive and you aren't banning her, then you can deal with her till then since she isn't worth your ban slot.

>Ahri is a purely skill shot reliant champ, but that does NOT mean she has a HIGH skill cap. in fact, she has a very moderate skill cap

That one sadly is a lie. Once she gets ahead, she has plenty of kill potential even when she misses every single skillshot in her Kit, and that's my main issue with her. Between thunderlords, items like ludens and protobelt and her autoaiming W+R, there is enough non avoidable damage for her to kill people without landing half her kit if she already did land a bit pf poke befor or if she's simply ahead.

The second issue i have is how much lanepreassure she has between Q and passive, it's just extremly mana efficient waveclear+poke and even if she trades even, her passive sustain makes her come out ahead in the end.
Imo her Ult damage could use some more nerfs, with maybe outting that damage on either her E or even Q(though for Q it could use some mechanic that scales with level rather than abillity rank, else her early would become to strong with any buffs to her Q). I'm totally fine with it's cd, the mobillity it gives is the point of the abillity, and ahrie relies on that alot later on, so lowering her acces to that would be not great imo.
Another good point for nerfs imo would be her passive, just lower the power vs minions and increases it vs champs like prettymuch all other per target heals do(renekton for example helas only 1/3 on minions with his Q), so Ahrie would have to try and lans her spells on a champ with the passive up for sustain rather than just spaming Q into minions.

You'd nerf her already crappy early game passive? Not to mention people have to stop using the "once x champion gets ahead" argument. It's a complete fallacy in itself and for good reason. Ahri has subpar early game trading potential. If you're losing trades early to Ahri on an early game champ, you're doing something wrong. Her Q has a 8 second CD early, you should be abusing that long window of time you have to trade with her once she misses.

She has to cast around 3 abilities (around 120-180 mana early) to get her passive, THEN burn her ability again (another 75/40 mana) to get her passive. Assuming you have AP runes and you have the standard 30 AP most people get at levels 1-5 Ahri heal grants her 3+2.7x6 (assuming you don't force her to waste her passive) -- this is the equivalent of popping a health pot. So lets say you trade at level 3 and she starts spamming skills to get this heal for it to be meaningful; she'll end up shoving wave to your tower and have no mana before she hits level 4. I highly doubt 25 hp every 40 seconds is something to really be complaining about, since you generally get more from passive HP regen anyways. And that's only IF she has a full wave of minions to hit. If she lets the wave build up to where she has around 12-15 minions to hit for a juicy 50-70 hp recovery, then she just played it well and should be rewarded for it anyways.

Her numbers don't need any tweaking. If you move anything around, it could potentially put her into a real balance issue state. As I've stated above, working with CDs and the movement speed Q are the only thing riot has to touch. Looking for number changes puts us in a bigger problem than we have now.

My entire post was about suggestions about how to fix Ahri's problematic safety pre-6 and even having that safety net while her ulti is on CD. Did I say anything about her being ungankable or unkillable? No. Did I say she needed extreme nerfs without compensation? No. I suggested some slight nerfs that may bring her back in line to not being "safely" obnoxious. She isn't overbearing or overpowered or any of the above points you mentioned. I haven't once brought up any such notion.

Also, every single argument you've used in your above post to my thread I have already used as to why she's fine. However, saying that she isn't a tad bit out of hand would be completely biased and unprofessional. I've offered up my solutions to the problem. If you have a better one, than shoot. As I've said, once you hit Plat+ (where most statics are taken into account) you have to understand that certain champs simply aren't that hard. If you have any inkling of how to hit a skill shot, you'll master Ahri in no time flat. 

Sure, you'll be able to do more fancy stuff when you get the hang of her, but those are almost as unnecessary as Lee's insects if you can find ways to compensate for your lack of mechanical ability.  We can go back and forth all day, but let me save you the trouble:

**Personally, I don't have a problem with Ahri. However, that's just me and while I do think that she's fine, that's just exactly what it is: My personal bias.**

I think making her Q movement speed only activate if she hits a champion and either extend the duration/refresh it if she hits a champion several times or multiple champions is the best course of action for her. I don't see her as oppressive in all honesty and I've never felt frustrated playing against her like I do against other champions who are not OP.
